ai_summary: Document appears to be a scanned bank balance certificate with standard redactions. I observed one clear concern: the page text explicitly states the output is computer-generated and not required to be signed, yet a round bank stamp and a handwritten signature are present. I did NOT find high-confidence technical tampering indicators (no obvious clone/paste artifacts, no repeated pixel blocks, and no clear compression inconsistencies) around the stamp, signature, or numeric table. Because only one high-confidence indicator is present and other checks are negative/ambiguous, I assess overall severity as LOW. There is some uncertainty because a physical stamp/signature could have been legitimately applied before scanning; if higher-resolution originals are available further forensic checks (pixel-level compression analysis, EXIF/scan-source comparison) are recommended.

fraud_signals.signal: Conflict between document statement ('computer generated output and is not required to be signed') and presence of a bank stamp and handwritten signature
No clear paste/clone artifacts, no repeated pixel blocks, and no obvious inconsistent compression around the stamp/signature or table (negative evidence)
Black rectangular redaction blocks over account identifiers (standard redaction behavior; not treated as tampering by default)
